TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit UsageStatsManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to device usage history and statistics.

remarks.para:
Provides access to device usage history and statistics. Usage data is aggregated into time intervals: days, weeks, months, and years.

When requesting usage data since a particular time, the request might look something like this:

A request for data in the middle of a time interval will include that interval.

NOTE: Most methods on this API require the permission android.permission.PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS. However, declaring the permission implies intention to use the API and the user of the device still needs to grant permission through the Settings application. See android.provider.Settings#ACTION_USAGE_ACCESS_SETTINGS. Methods which only return the information for the calling package do not require this permission. E.g. #getAppStandbyBucket() and #queryEventsForSelf(long, long).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the current standby bucket of the calling app.
Docs.value: the current standby bucket of the calling app. One of STANDBY_BUCKET_* constants.

remarks.para: Returns the current standby bucket of the calling app. The system determines the standby state of the app based on app usage patterns. Standby buckets determine how much an app will be restricted from running background tasks such as jobs and alarms.

Restrictions increase progressively from #STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE to #STANDBY_BUCKET_RESTRICTED, with #STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE being the least restrictive. The battery level of the device might also affect the restrictions.
Apps in buckets ≤ #STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE have no standby restrictions imposed. Apps in buckets > #STANDBY_BUCKET_FREQUENT may have network access restricted when running in the background.

The standby state of an app can change at any time either due to a user interaction or a system interaction or some algorithm determining that the app can be restricted for a period of time before the user has a need for it.
You can also query the recent history of standby bucket changes by calling #queryEventsForSelf(long, long) and searching for UsageEvents.Event#STANDBY_BUCKET_CHANGED.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsAppInactive(string packageName) cil managed

Docs.param: The package name of the app to query
Docs.summary: Returns whether the specified app is currently considered inactive.
Docs.returns: whether the app is currently considered inactive or false if querying another app without android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS

remarks.para: Returns whether the specified app is currently considered inactive. This will be true if the app hasn't been used directly or indirectly for a period of time defined by the system. This could be of the order of several hours or days. Apps are not considered inactive when the device is charging.
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS to query the inactive state of other apps
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, class Android.App.Usage.UsageStats> QueryAndAggregateUsageStats(int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: A convenience method that queries for all stats in the given range (using the best interval for that range), merges the resulting data, and keys it by package name.
Docs.returns: A java.util.Map keyed by package name

remarks.para: A convenience method that queries for all stats in the given range (using the best interval for that range), merges the resulting data, and keys it by package name. See #queryUsageStats(int, long, long).
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.App.Usage.ConfigurationStats>? QueryConfigurations (Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, long beginTime, long endTime);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.App.Usage.ConfigurationStats> QueryConfigurations(valuetype Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The time interval by which the stats are aggregated.
The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: Gets the hardware configurations the device was in for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

remarks.para: Gets the hardware configurations the device was in for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval. The results are ordered as in #queryUsageStats(int, long, long).
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
Note: Starting from android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R Android R, if the user's device is not in an unlocked state (as defined by UserManager#isUserUnlocked()), then null will be returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public Android.App.Usage.UsageEvents? QueryEvents (long beginTime, long endTime);
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.App.Usage.UsageEvents QueryEvents(int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The inclusive beginning of the range of events to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of events to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: Query for events in the given time range.

remarks.para: Query for events in the given time range. Events are only kept by the system for a few days.
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
Note: Starting from android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R Android R, if the user's device is not in an unlocked state (as defined by UserManager#isUserUnlocked()), then null will be returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The inclusive beginning of the range of events to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of events to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: Like #queryEvents(long, long), but only returns events for the calling package.

remarks.para: Like #queryEvents(long, long), but only returns events for the calling package. Note: Starting from android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R Android R, if the user's device is not in an unlocked state (as defined by UserManager#isUserUnlocked()), then null will be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.App.Usage.EventStats>? QueryEventStats (Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, long beginTime, long endTime);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.App.Usage.EventStats> QueryEventStats(valuetype Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The time interval by which the stats are aggregated.
The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: Gets aggregated event stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

remarks.para: Gets aggregated event stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.
The returned list will contain a EventStats object for each event type that is being aggregated and has data for an interval that is a subset of the time range given.
The current event types that will be aggregated here are:

• UsageEvents.Event#SCREEN_INTERACTIVE
  • UsageEvents.Event#SCREEN_NON_INTERACTIVE
  • UsageEvents.Event#KEYGUARD_SHOWN
  • UsageEvents.Event#KEYGUARD_HIDDEN
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
Note: Starting from android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R Android R, if the user's device is not in an unlocked state (as defined by UserManager#isUserUnlocked()), then null will be returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Android.App.Usage.UsageStats>? QueryUsageStats (Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, long beginTime, long endTime);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.App.Usage.UsageStats> QueryUsageStats(valuetype Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval intervalType, int64 beginTime, int64 endTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The time interval by which the stats are aggregated.
The inclusive beginning of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
The exclusive end of the range of stats to include in the results. Defined in terms of "Unix time", see java.lang.System#currentTimeMillis.
Docs.summary: Gets application usage stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

remarks.para: Gets application usage stats for the given time range, aggregated by the specified interval.

The returned list will contain one or more UsageStats objects for each package, with usage data that covers at least the given time range. Note: The begin and end times of the time range may be expanded to the nearest whole interval period.
The caller must have android.Manifest.permission#PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
Note: Starting from android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R Android R, if the user's device is not in an unlocked state (as defined by UserManager#isUserUnlocked()), then null will be returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket StandbyBucketActive = (10)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: The app was used very recently, currently in use or likely to be used very soon.

remarks.para: The app was used very recently, currently in use or likely to be used very soon. Standby bucket values that are ≤ #STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE will not be throttled by the system while they are in this bucket. Buckets > #STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE will most likely be restricted in some way. For instance, jobs and alarms may be deferred.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket StandbyBucketFrequent = (30)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: The app was used in the last few days and/or likely to be used in the next few days.

remarks.para: The app was used in the last few days and/or likely to be used in the next few days. Restrictions will apply to these apps, such as deferral of jobs and alarms. The delays may be greater than for apps in higher buckets (lower bucket value). Bucket values > #STANDBY_BUCKET_FREQUENT may additionally have network access limited.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket StandbyBucketRare = (40)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: The app has not be used for several days and/or is unlikely to be used for several days.

remarks.para: The app has not be used for several days and/or is unlikely to be used for several days. Apps in this bucket will have more restrictions, including network restrictions, except during certain short periods (at a minimum, once a day) when they are allowed to execute jobs, access the network, etc.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval StandbyBucketRestricted = (45)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.UsageStatsInterval enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: The app has not be used for several days, is unlikely to be used for several days, and has been misbehaving in some manner.

remarks.para: The app has not be used for several days, is unlikely to be used for several days, and has been misbehaving in some manner. Apps in this bucket will have the most restrictions, including network restrictions and additional restrictions on jobs.
Note: this bucket is not enabled in Build.VERSION_CODES#R.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.Usage.StandbyBucket enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: The app was used recently and/or likely to be used in the next few hours.

remarks.para: The app was used recently and/or likely to be used in the next few hours. Restrictions will apply to these apps, such as deferral of jobs and alarms.
